column2: NORTH CAROLINA DMV PERMIT PRACTICE TEST
column4: North Carolina
column6: NC

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. The sign in the picture:
column4: indicates the minimum ramp speed at the highway exit point.
column6: is a warning sign.
column8: is used to advise motorists of the appropriate ramp speed at the highway exit point.
column10: shows the highest speed drivers can travel at the exit of the intersection.

column2: 2. This road sign means:
column4: You must make a complete stop
column6: Stop if necessary
column8: Yield the right-of-way to oncoming vehicles

column2: 3. What should drivers do when the red lights begin to flash?
column4: Turn off the ignition.
column6: Slow down.
column8: Stop.

column2: 4. This road sign means:
column4: You may proceed only if the way is clear
column6: U-turns are prohibited
column8: You are about to enter a one-way street the wrong way

column2: 5. A flashing red light:
column4: means that you must bring your vehicle to a complete halt.
column6: means the same thing as a stop sign.
column8: is used at dangerous intersections.

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column4: Intersection ahead
column6: Sharp curves ahead
column8: Merging traffic from the right

column2: 7. This sign means:
column4: Traffic signal ahead
column6: Emergency stop ahead
column8: The traffic signal ahead is out of order
column10: you must yield to the traffic signal ahead.

column2: 8. A pedestrian in the crosswalk when the 'DON’T WALK' signal begins flashing must:
column4: finish crossing the street.
column6: go back and wait the “WALK” light
column8: stop immediately.

column2: 9. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: not turn right.
column6: slow down and keep well to the left.
column8: increase their speed and keep well to the right.
column10: slow down and keep well to the right.

column2: 10. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: they are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column6: the one-way street or roadway is about to change to two-way traffic.
column8: they cannot go straight ahead.

column2: 11. This sign means:
column4: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.
column6: Divided highway ends.
column8: Divided highway ahead.

column2: 12. This sign means:
column4: Double curve ahead.
column6: Road slippery when wet. Drive slowly.
column8: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.
column10: The road will curve to the right, then to the left.

column2: 13. A speed limit is the __________ speed at which a vehicle may legally travel on the road under ideal conditions.
column4: suggested
column6: maximum
column8: minimum

column2: 14. When you pass another vehicle, before you return to the right lane, you must:
column4: make sure you can see the front bumper of the vehicle you passed.
column6: look at your interior rear-view mirror.
column8: signal.

column2: 15. You are driving and you are feeling drowsy. You should:
column4: avoid drinking coffee.
column6: turn on the radio to keep you awake.
column8: find a safe place to stop for a break.
column10: have a beer or two to keep you awake.

column2: 16. An edge line that angles toward the center of the road indicates that:
column4: you must turn right.
column6: there’s a narrow bridge ahead.
column8: the road is narrower ahead.

column2: 17. Smoking while driving:
column4: is not distracting.
column6: is distracting.
column8: helps increase driver alertness.

column2: 18. When changing lanes, you should not:
column4: use the inside rearview mirror to check for blind spots
column6: signal your intentions early.
column8: check your side and rear view mirrors.
column10: check to see if other drivers are moving into the same lane.

column2: 19. As you approach an intersection, the traffic light changes from green to yellow. You should:
column4: be prepared to stop in the middle of the intersection.
column6: apply the brakes sharply and come to a complete stop.
column8: be prepared to stop before the intersection.
column10: speed up to beat the red light.

column2: 20. Drivers may pass another vehicle if the line dividing two lanes is a ________ line.
column4: broken white
column6: double solid yellow
column8: solid white

column2: 21. Drivers may need more space in front of their vehicle:
column4: when it is hard to see ahead.
column6: when carrying a heavy load or pulling a trailer.
column8: when following motorcycles.

column2: 22. Select the most effective safety restraint(s) in a traffic crash.
column4: Air bag only
column6: Lap and shoulder belt only
column8: A combination of lap/shoulder belt and air bag.

column2: 23. What should you do if your headlights suddenly go out?
column4: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column6: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column8: Brake immediately and activate your emergency lights.
column10: Use your emergency lights, parking lights or directional signals.

column2: 24. When changing lanes, you should:
column4: signal, change lanes and check your mirrors.
column6: signal, check your mirrors and blind spot in the direction you plan to move, then change lanes.
column8: signal and change lanes.
column10: check your mirrors, signal and change lanes.

column2: 25. Drivers must be prepared for anything coming up in the road ahead. They should:
column4: drive with the right foot resting lightly on the brake pedal.
column6: scan the road for traffic conditions and possible hazards.
column8: maintain focus toward the left of the road.
column10: stare straight ahead at all times.

column2: 26. Your car stalls on the tracks at a railroad crossing, and a collision with a train is imminent. After getting yourself and your passengers out of the car, you should:
column4: get back into the vehicle.
column6: run toward the train but stay off the tracks.
column8: cross the tracks.

column2: 27. What should you do if you see smoke come from under the hood?
column4: Try to fight the fire yourself.
column6: Jump off your car immediately, if it is safe to do so.
column8: Pull off the road and park your vehicle. Turn off the ignition, get away from the car and call the fire department.
column10: Call the fire department and then pull off the road and park your vehicle.

column2: 28. Who is most at risk?
column4: Experienced drivers.
column6: Drivers who have traditional work schedules.
column8: Drivers who have overslept.
column10: Drivers who are driving long distances without rest breaks.

column2: 29. You can pass on the right:
column4: when a vehicle ahead makes a right turn.
column6: when a vehicle that is approaching from the opposite direction is prepared to turn left.
column8: when a vehicle ahead makes a left turn.
column10: when passing is restricted by parked cars.

column2: 30. A steady green light at intersections means:
column4: You may not turn right
column6: You may drive through the intersection if the road is clear
column8: You must stop and check for oncoming traffic before proceeding

column2: 31. Left turns on a red light are allowed:
column4: at intersections, after stopping, if the way is clear.
column6: Never.
column8: in school zones.
column10: from a one-way street into a one-way street.

column2: 32. If your car breaks down on the highway, you should:
column4: flash your headlights at oncoming traffic.
column6: stop in the right lane.
column8: use your four-way flashers to warn other drivers.
column10: sound your horn to warn passing vehicles.

column2: 33. The effects of alcohol on driving do NOT include:
column4: Better reflexes
column6: Improved judgement
column8: Better concentration

column2: 34. When other drivers around you are acting in anger, you should:
column4: distance yourself from the situation.
column6: avoid making eye contact.
column8: slow down or move over safely.

column2: 35. When exiting a highway, you should slow down:
column4: once you have moved into the exit lane.
column6: once you see the toll booth.
column8: before moving into the exit lane.
column10: when you first see the exit sign.

column2: 36. If you are blinded by headlights on an approaching vehicle, you should:
column4: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.
column6: move your eyes to the right.
column8: use the road edge as a guide until the approaching vehicle passes by.

column2: 37. When you drive near parks and playgrounds, you should expect children:
column4: to stop at the curb before crossing the street.
column6: to suddenly run into the street.
column8: to know when it is safe to cross.
column10: not to cross unless they are with an adult.
